title: With Festivities Around The Corner, Here Are 12 Pre-Diwali Things I Simply Don't Like
text:
With Festivities Around The Corner, Here Are 12 Pre-Diwali Things I Simply Don't Like

With Festivities Around The Corner, Here Are 12 Pre-Diwali Things I Simply Don't Like

The festival of lights is here again.

From playing cards to buying gifts for loved ones, Diwali comes with a lot of things that we all crave for. Charming lights, delectable sweets, and traditional Diwali attire, Diwali is one festival every Indian looks forward to.

No matter how amazing this festival is, there are loads of pre-Diwali things that put me off. Here is a list of exactly those things.

1. Cleaning the entire place. The task seem unending and leaves you exhausted.

Unsplash

2. Going from one house to another with parents to distribute gifts.

Unspalsh

3. Putting up lights in the exact order you mother tells you to.

Unsplash





4. Going to at least 10 markets for 10 different things.

Unsplash

5. The market chaos where one can barely walk.

Unsplash

6. Small talk with distant relatives when they come to our place.

Unsplash

7. When people start burning crackers before Diwali.

Unsplash

8. Excess traffic on roads that makes everything harder.

Unsplash

9. Pollution and smoke all around.

Unsplash

10. Pre-Diwali card games because I don't know how to play many.

Unsplash

11. Drunk people on the road.

Unsplash

12. Working on Diwali.

Unsplash
